content.user_title: Lead Quality Management for HealthTech Organizations
content.value_statement: HealthTech and MedTech companies face complex quality system requirements across multiple jurisdictions. This skill provides senior quality manager expertise for ISO 13485 compliance, regulatory oversight, and strategic quality leadership.
actual_capabilities: Provides overall quality management system oversight and accountability
Guides regulatory compliance across EU MDR, FDA QSR, and ISO 13485 requirements
Leads management review processes with strategic quality planning
Develops quality KPIs and performance monitoring frameworks
Establishes quality culture and organizational quality leadership
Manages regulatory authority relationships and certification programs
limitations: Does not execute regulatory submissions or interact with authorities directly
Does not replace qualified legal or regulatory affairs professionals
Does not provide device-specific clinical or technical documentation

use_cases.title: Strategic Quality Planning
use_cases.description: Develop quality strategies aligned with business objectives and regulatory requirements across multiple markets.

use_cases.title: Compliance Oversight
use_cases.description: Monitor multi-jurisdictional compliance status and prepare for regulatory authority inspections and audits.

use_cases.title: QMS Implementation
use_cases.description: Establish quality management system governance, document controls, and continuous improvement processes.

prompt_templates.title: QMS Overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide an overview of QMR responsibilities for a medical device company seeking ISO 13485 certification.

prompt_templates.title: Compliance Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the key compliance requirements for FDA QSR 21 CFR 820 and EU MDR 2017/745 for a Class II medical device?

prompt_templates.title: Management Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a quarterly management review agenda covering quality system effectiveness, regulatory compliance, and quality culture.

prompt_templates.title: Quality Strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Develop a 3-year quality strategic plan for a growing MedTech company expanding from US to European markets.

output_examples.input: What are the key elements of an effective CAPA management system under ISO 13485?
output: Root cause analysis methodology (5-Why, fishbone diagram, FMEA)
Corrective action documentation with effectiveness verification
Trend analysis and metrics for nonconformity tracking
Linkage to document control and change management
Management review integration for systemic issue escalation

output_examples.input: How should we prepare for an FDA inspection of our quality system?
output: Pre-inspection readiness assessment covering all QSR subsystems
Documentation review and organization (DHR, DMR, DHF)
Interview preparation for key personnel roles
Common inspection findings and remediation strategies
Post-inspection response planning and CAPA development

best_practices: Integrate quality considerations into product development from concept through commercialization
Maintain proactive regulatory intelligence to anticipate compliance requirement changes
Establish clear quality metrics and review them regularly with senior leadership
anti_patterns: Waiting until audit findings to address systemic quality issues
Treating quality management as a documentation exercise rather than a cultural commitment
Neglecting to involve cross-functional teams in quality system governance

faq.question: What is the difference between QMR and a Quality Assurance Manager?
faq.answer: QMR has organizational accountability for quality system effectiveness, while QA managers handle day-to-day quality operations.

faq.question: How often should management reviews be conducted?
faq.answer: ISO 13485 requires documented management review at planned intervals. Quarterly reviews are industry standard.

faq.question: What qualifications does a QMR need?
faq.answer: Regulatory requirements vary, but typically include quality system experience, regulatory knowledge, and organizational authority.

faq.question: How do EU MDR and FDA QSR requirements differ?
faq.answer: EU MDR emphasizes clinical evaluation and post-market surveillance, while FDA QSR focuses on design controls and manufacturing.

faq.question: Can this skill help with ISO 13485 certification preparation?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides guidance on certification requirements, audit preparation, and continuous improvement for maintaining certification.

faq.question: What quality metrics should we track?
faq.answer: Key metrics include process effectiveness, customer satisfaction, audit findings, CAPA closure rates, and product quality indicators.
